Name: BMIS normalizer
Description: Performs best-matched internal standard normalization on raw peak areas.

Parameters.Name: Internal standard regex
Parameters.Description: A regular expression used to detect the internal standards that should be used for normalization. E.g. if all IS names have the pattern Name, 13C[digits] you might use ", 13C". This is passed directly to str_detect in R.

Parameters.Name: Pooled sample regex
Parameters.Description: BMIS operates on pooled samples. Define a regular expression here that allows for their detection from the sample name, e.g. "_pooled_". Passed directly to str_detect.

Parameters.Name: Dilution regex
Parameters.Description: BMIS operates on the difference between full-strength and half-strength samples. Define a regular expression here that allows for their distinction from the sample name, e.g. "Half|Full". Passed directly to str_extract and must return "Full" for those samples that shouldn't be diluted.

Parameters.Name: Minimal improvement threshold
Parameters.Description: BMIS requires that normalizing to an internal standard result in a given amount of improvement in the RSD, e.g. 40%. Define that threshold here.

Parameters.Name: Already good enough threshold
Parameters.Description: BMIS avoids normalizing samples that already have a low RSD by skipping samples with an RSD below a given threshold. Define the RSD of an "already good" compound here.

Parameters.Name: Exclude standards and blanks
Parameters.Description: Exclude the standard and blank files (matching '_Std_|Blk_Blk') from the normalization? Neither of these have IS added so normalizing to them often gives uninterpretable results.
